fields.description:
Set features on creating a repository
* Can turn features off but not on without full rescan: warn if features turn on and continue with lower feature set.

Create a unit test for creating a repo - test that the correct features are set in cru-only and normal mode.
fields.summary: Set slurp features when creating a repository

fields.description: Following on from CRUC-3687, implement the content indexing toggle for SVN.
fields.summary: lightFE: Implement content indexing feature toggle for SVN

fields.description:
*Currently*:
* Each revision has a A_CSID.
* There is an index E_CSID_TO_REVID
* Clearcase has E_COMMITS which tracks commit hashes
* DVCS has a E_COMMIT_PARENTS index for the parents of each commit, and E_COMMITS to track commit hashes
* CVS has E_CSID_TO_REVID (actually now unused)
* P4 has its own I_CHANGESETID_REVID (which long-long version of E_CSID_TO_REVID, which is string-long?)
* SVN has a similar I_CHANGESETID_REVID

*Proposal*:

Put a E_CHANGESET entity into CommonSchema, with the following attributes
* String csid
* date, authorid
* commentid
* String branches[] (a)
* Tags[] - this may already be stored as a reverse index somewhere else, and may only be applicable for some SCM's

This will later be extended to include ChangeSetFileSummary information(See CRUC

At the moment, we don't need any infdb indexes on those attributes as it is indexed in the cross-repo search

Merge the above per-scm entities into the cross-scm one, where possible/sane.

Calling cache.getChangeset() should hit E_CHANGESET and not do its "get details from first revision" douchbagery that it currently does.

Similar to file HEAD ness tracking, we need to track the HEAD ness of branches - is it better to do this as processing a commit or to do it at the end of a batch by calling ""hg branches" (which we will have to do anyway to track branch state)

*Migration*:
We should be able to build this index on upgrade - may have special code for git/hg to detect remove the single filerev on "/" we put in to work around issues.

*Tests*

*Multiple ChangeSet Parents*


Currently does store all parents.

    * git supports multiple parents: stored
    * hg supports a primary parent and a merge (secondary) parent: stored
    * svn supports merging, but not stored in db.

Downstream, this would enable support for:

    * Display of multiple parent revisions in:
          o Activity Stream
          o ChangeSet view page: .../changelog/REPO?cs=XXXX
          o Crucible Commit Lists
          o Other locations?
    * Graph View for ChangeSets
fields.summary: Make Changesets first-class entities

fields.description:
Follows CRUC-3686: Implement a no-LoC indexing feature for SVN and make lightFE use it by default

Implement and write unit tests.

Following this we will require migration to detect a repo that has this feature turned off but we have a FishEye licence.
fields.summary: Implement LoC indexing feature for SVN

fields.description:
Add in feature toggles for scanning engines
* Index diffs
* Index content
* Index revision metadata (author, date, comment)
* Index quicksearch (filename, changeset info?, camelcase filenames)
* Index Tags
* Index Line Counts
fields.summary: Create feature toggles for slurping
Refactoring of repository life cycle to simplify adding of common indexing options for lightFE work.

fields.description:
When a crucible licence holder adds or removes a FishEye licence:

When licence removed: Throw exception and don't start repo if more features in repo than allowed by licence (implemented in current behaviour)

When licence added: 
* Allow user to continue with possibly reduced functionality: (good) Allows users to continue to use crucible while their repo is being indexed (for some users, could take weeks) - (bad) reviews would be split between the old and new repos
** Log a warning about reduced features
** Display a banner when viewing the repo about reduced features
* Force user to reindex: (good) all reviews on one repo, best for most people with smallish repos (bad) for big repos where no reviews possible while re-indexing

Add Unit Test for the Licence Added behaviour

Admin changes split out as CRUC-4135
fields.summary: lightFE indexing features - migration

fields.description:
Classification: Not conforming to standards
Ranking: Minor

Created by Nick Pellow from Michael Studman's Crucible defect on FieldGroup.ui.xml line 13 https://extranet.atlassian.com/crucible/cru/CR-FE-4378#c37268 :

Use class="description" (relevant style: form.aui > div.description) to harmonize with AUI

I had a quick play with the DOM and set that div to class "description" and that still left the text not in line with the text box above. They need to be in line.
fields.summary: Use class="description" (relevant style: form.aui > div.description) to harmonize with AUI  I had a quick play with the DOM and set that div to class "description" and that still left the text not in line with the text box above. They need to be in line.

fields.description:
Upon upgrade to 2.4 from 3.6, if you load the default Dashboard while your repositories are reindex you get the following error message in the logs:

{noformat}
14:58:56 ERROR - Nested in javax.servlet.ServletException: javax.el.ELException: java.lang.IllegalStateException: Indexer is stopped (com.atlassian.crucible.activity.lucene.DefaultReviewItemIndexer@1291e95):
javax.el.ELException: java.lang.IllegalStateException: Indexer is stopped (com.atlassian.crucible.activity.lucene.DefaultReviewItemIndexer@1291e95)
        at javax.el.BeanELResolver.getValue(BeanELResolver.java:298)
        at javax.el.CompositeELResolver.getValue(CompositeELResolver.java:175)
        at com.sun.el.parser.AstValue.getValue(AstValue.java:138)
        at com.sun.el.ValueExpressionImpl.getValue(ValueExpressionImpl.java:206)
        at org.apache.jasper.runtime.PageContextImpl.evaluateExpression(PageContextImpl.java:1001)
        at org.apache.jsp.WEB_002dINF.jsp.user.anonHome_jsp._jspx_meth_rend_toolsDropDown_0(anonHome_jsp.java:1021)
        at org.apache.jsp.WEB_002dINF.jsp.user.anonHome_jsp.access$1000(anonHome_jsp.java:7)
        at org.apache.jsp.WEB_002dINF.jsp.user.anonHome_jsp$anonHome_jspHelper.invoke12(anonHome_jsp.java:1181)
        at org.apache.jsp.WEB_002dINF.jsp.user.anonHome_jsp$anonHome_jspHelper.invoke(anonHome_jsp.java:1250)
        at org.apache.jsp.tag.web.cru.threePanelPageContent_tag.doTag(threePanelPageContent_tag.java:756)
        at org.apache.jsp.WEB_002dINF.jsp.user.anonHome_jsp._jspx_meth_rend_threePanelPageContent_0(anonHome_jsp.java:339)
        at org.apache.jsp.WEB_002dINF.jsp.user.anonHome_jsp._jspService(anonHome_jsp.java:143)
        at org.apache.jasper.runtime.HttpJspBase.service(HttpJspBase.java:109)
...
{noformat}

It also appears in the UI:

!error.jpeg!

The issue eventually goes away once indexing has completed.
fields.summary: "IllegalStateException: Indexer is stopped" on 2.4 Upgrade

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:

# Create a new ClearCase repository in the admin
# Add the required fields on page 1 and 2 of the wizard
# On the page 2, enter something in both the 'Include Pattern' and 'Exclude Pattern' under the 'ClearCase VOB Inclusion Rules' section
# Now select a vob from the 'VOB to include' dropdown
# Click 'Test connection'; nothing happens
# Click 'Next' and then 'Add'; nothing happens

The same happens for the 'ClearCase Project Inclusion Rules' section when 'UCM' is checked.
The same happens when editing an existing repository

The workaround is to clear the 'Include Pattern' and 'Exclude Pattern' sections when specifying a particular VOB/UCM Project.
fields.summary: ClearCase: 'Add' and 'Test Connection' buttons in admin don't do anything when both 'VOB To Include' and 'Include Pattern' and/or 'Exclude Pattern' is specified

1) The toolbar on all the tables is 2px too wide (on one side). Couldn't see how to fix this (actually, the toolbar is 720px and the table beneath is 718px so perhaps that's the best place to start looking)

fields.description:
com.atlassian.fisheye.clearcase.ClearCaseRepositoryScanner.processClearCaseCommit(ClearCaseChangeDetails) calls getDiffInfo even when it is a version 0 rev (which is initiated here: com.atlassian.fisheye.clearcase.client.ClearCaseChangeParser.processChange(String, String, String, ClearCaseContext)).

This creates a log message which users find disconcerting. we should check and not do this in this case.
fields.summary: ClearCase: unnecesarily calling diff on revision 0

fields.description: The recent changeset service offers a method "listChangesets" that doesn't return anything unless an 'expand' parameter is specified. This needs to be documented in detail in the REST API docs as it appears that the service isn't working or that there aren't any changesets.

fields.description:
The ability to specify a path segment in the Include/Exclude dialog in Fisheye/Crucible 2.4.0 is broken.  See the screenshots for the error.

!error1.jpeg!

!error2.jpeg!

Error is {{Invalid pattern: Dangling meta character '*' near index 7 trunk/**/*.dll ^}}.  At this point the only workaround is to stop Fisheye and manually edit the {{config.xml}} file.
fields.summary: Path segments in Include/Exclude cannot be parsed in 2.4.0

fields.description: The Review index will fail to index if there are null values which try to be indexed - such as a {{null}} review title. This can occur on databases which have very old data.

	at com.atlassian.fisheye.git.GitScanner.processGitCommit(GitScanner.java:349)

fields.description:
To reproduce:

# Go to https://atlaseye.atlassian.com/browse/intsys/internal-systems
# Select Tools->RSS

Result:

Empty feed

It's actually been that way for a month or more; sorry, I assumed it was a known issue.

fields.description: During changeset indexing (for QuickNav and the activity stream), a list of changesets is kept in memory. Each changeset keeps references to the FileRevisions associated with the changeset. When a large blocksize is used, or there are many filerevisions in the changesets, OutOfMemoryExceptions occur.
fields.summary: Too many objects are kept in memory during changeset indexing, resulting in an OutOfMemoryException

!http://img.skitch.com/20101027-nugb7cdepxwyf6826u8n3h7iyy.jpg! 

You can still browse http://yourfisheyeinstance.com:8060/changelog and get the content: 

!http://img.skitch.com/20101027-eypsk4ensrgq8rrse61d35nsxr.jpg!

fields.description: causes the sending of the batch to fail, and everyone previously in that batch gets the same mail over and over again
fields.summary: Error when sending changeset notifications to users with a batch-email preference

fields.description:
The Git documentation needs to be reviewed and updated. 

See the following customer comments:
* http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/FISHEYE/Git?focusedCommentId=223216779#comment-223216779
* http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/FISHEYE/Git?focusedCommentId=224396068#comment-224396068

h4. Collated Customer Comments
* _(listed below)_ Provide a sample of how to integrate with a private repository. For example, a repository managed with gitosis.
* Provide examples of what a repository location should look like.
* Provide instructions on how to add a file-system based repository.
* Provide details on how instructions differ for Windows.
* Provide information on Git branches and how they are handled.
fields.summary: Improve the Git documentation

fields.description:
The Git support for FishEye doesn't deal with copies and moves from outside the watches area to inside the watched area correctly. The behaviour should be:

* moves from inside -> outside should be treated as a delete
* moves from outside -> inside should be treated as a new file
* copies from inside -> outside should be ignored
* copies from outside -> inside should be treated as a new file
fields.summary: Git: fix support for includes/excludes for moving and copying from the excluded parts to the included parts of the repo and vice versa.

fields.description:
This happens both when a new ClearCase repository is added in the GWT admin and when an existing repo is edited, although the delays are most noticeable when editing an existing repository.

There are a number of issues that need to be addressed:

*New repository*
The command for getting the contents of the VOBs and UCM Projects dropdowns are independent of the viewlocation, but a reload trigger is attached to the view location field. This trigger should be removed and instead a trigger should be added to the displaying of the 'VOB Inclusion Rules' and the 'UCM PRoject Inclusion Rules' sections. The list of VOBs and UCM Projects will not change, so each of the commands should run only once.

*Editing a repository*
When you click a ClearCase repository in the new GWT admin, it takes a couple of seconds before the popup shows up. The reason is that during initialisation, the admin performs a number of cleartool commands to build up dropdown lists on the 'SCM Details' tab (vobs, projects and branches). This really shouldn't be done until the 'SCM Details' tab is actually selected. The result is that for up to 8 seconds there's a small spinner on the page before the admin popup shows up. The spinner is easy to miss and therefore it looks like the ui is not responding..
fields.summary: GWT admin for ClearCase is slow because cleartool commands are being executed too often and too early

fields.description:
When adding a CC repository, in the section "Clearcase VOB Inclusion Rules" (page 2), the user is not allowed to select both a VOB to include or a set of include/exclude patterns.

Make a control (ex: two radio buttons) to allow the user to select which option she/he want to enter (a VOB to include or a set of include/exclude patterns).
fields.summary: Clearcase admin: add UI feedback to select either the "VOB to include" or incldue/exclude patterns

fields.description:
In 1 repository, calls to ClearCaseContext.formatVersionId were causing StringIndexOutOfBoundsExceptions because the method was called with versionId that was equal to the view location.

I've added error handling, but more investigation is needed to determine whether this indicates a more serious problem.
fields.summary: ClearCase: investigate under what conditions ClearCaseContext.formatVersionId is called with an invalid version string

fields.description:
There are some files in our reference base-sanity repository that show text files as binary files on the changeset page.

Example: scratch\test.txt
fields.summary: ClearCase: base cc - some text files are marked as binary in the changeset page

fields.description: When using the 'autocreate view' feature, FishEye will not create a new view if the view 'vob_fisheye' already exists. However, if this existing view is not located in the directory provided in the 'view location' field, it will still try to run all cleartool commands from that directory and fail.
fields.summary: ClearCase autocreate view broken if view already exists (in a different location)

fields.description:
There is a bug in the FishEye indexing code for ClearCase repositories for branches that have been defined in a VOB, but have never been used. In the case of a customer (FSH-4960), there is a branch 'branchA' which has been defined in vob \vobB, but there no versions exist on the branch. 

In detail:
* FishEye executes {{cleartool lstype -fmt %n\n -kind brtype -invob vob:\vobB}} to get  list of branches for the VOB.
* One of the branches that is defined in the \vobB vob is {{branchA}}.
* FishEye retrieves the history for branch {{branchA}} by executing {{cleartool lshistory -fmt %Nd###%o###%u###'%c'###%Xn\n-nco -all -since 10-January-2007.10:08:12 -branch branchA \vobB}}. Cleartool returns 'Error: Branch type not found: "branchA".
* FishEye correctly intercepts the error and ignores the error and returns that there is no information for that branch in the VOB.
* FishEye *incorrectly* concludes that the VOB path was wrong and tries again with the leading slash.
* Cleartool returns an error which isn't caught and indexing stops.

The fix is to not retry with a leading slash. The problem could not be reproduced using a Linux installation where the vobs are mounted on \. It's likely (but not verified) that this problem only occurs on Windows using snapshot views.

A workaround is to explicitly exclude the branch(es) that are causing the problems in the FishEye repository configuration.
fields.summary: ClearCase: indexing stops when a branch is defined but never used in a VOB.

fields.description:
The FishEye repository admin page for ClearCase repositories contains drop-down lists for selecting VOBs, UCM Projects and branches. Cleartool commands are being executed to populate the drop-down lists, but on medium to large ClearCase installations these commands can take a long time to complete.

We should redesign the admin page for ClearCase repositories to not execute any cleartool commands at all. For example:

* replace the drop-down lists with standard text input fields.
* add validation to verify that the VOBs/UCM projects that are specified exist.

But this would also be a good opportunity to look how we can simplify the repository admin for ClearCase. Some thoughts:

* Simply allow the user to specify a number of views to be included in the repository. All versions that are visible from one or more of the views (including the ancestry) should be indexed by FishEye.
fields.summary: ClearCase: admin is not performant for big ClearCase installations
Error generated when attempting to create a review from a ClearCase change set
ClearCase FishEye indexer is re-indexing changes it has already indexed.

fields.description:
When retrieving the file contents we get the file contents from cleartool and store them in a temporary file. After we have read this file, the file is deleted. 

If two threads try to get the same file at the same time, we get a FileNotFoundException from thread 1 because the file was deleted by thread 2 before it was read by thread 1. We should make sure that multiple threads cannot get in each others way.
fields.summary: ClearCase get file content causes exceptions when multiple users are trying to get the same file at the same time

fields.description:
On the admin screens for clearcase repos, you can add branch inclusion and exclusion rules. In the dropdown list the same branch is listed multiple times, probably once for every VOB in which it is defined.

This functionality should be improved to either:
* add the VOB name to the item in the drop down list. If you want to include/exclude a branch in multiple vobs, you have to create an include/exclude rule for each of the vobs.
* as above, but add a 'for all vobs' item for each of the branch names.
fields.summary: ClearCase: Branch inclusion/exclusion shows same branch multiple times in drop down

fields.description:
In the 2.4.0 release, the cleartool command to list the branches in a VOB has changed to exclude branches that are defined, but have no versions on them.

The new query is much slower however, especially for large VOBs.
fields.summary: ClearCase: performance of incremental indexing has decreased in 2.4.0 (Base CC only)

fields.description: Currently, there is a bug in the ClearCase UCM support which causes FishEye not to pick up any activities for UCM projects, unless the view is created using the 'auto create view' feature.
fields.summary: ClearCase UCM support only works when using 'autocreate view' feature

fields.description:
While doing a reindex of a ClearCase repository:

Once, refresh on Admin screen on repo doing reindex caused IExplorer process CPU to max out.
fields.summary: Reload of admin page causes CPU max out
ClearCase: custom element types are treated as binary files.
FishEye - ClearCase incorrectly detects a dynamic view as snapshot view when FE is not started with current view set to dynamic view

fields.description:
In UCM ClearCase, you can include 'modifiable components' in your UCM project. Any component that is defined in the administrative VOB hierarchy of the projects PVOB can be used. 

FishEye only indexes UCM components that are defined in the project's PVOB. Currently, FishEye uses the following logic to find UCM activities that contain changes:

# {{cleartool lscomp -fmt %\[root_dir\]p -invob /path/of/pvob}} - to get the list of component root directories for components defined in the UCM PVOB
# {{cleartool lshistory -since <date of last indexed change> -branch <branch-name> <component-root-dir>}} - to get the clearcase change events for the component.
\\
\\
This needs to be changed to:
\\
\\
# {{cleartool desc -fmt %\[mod_comps\]Xp project:projectName@/path/of/project/pvob}} - to get a list of modifiable components for the UCM PVOB
# {{cleartool lscomp -fmt "%\[root_dir\]p" component:compName@/path/of/component/pvob}} - to get the root-directory for a component (can be cached)
# {{cleartool lshistory -since <date of last indexed change> -branch <branch-name> <component-root-dir>}} - to get the clearcase change events for the component.
\\
\\
This will include all the _modifiable components_.
fields.summary: UCM ClearCase: FishEye doesn't index project components that aren't components of the project's PVOB
HG: Improve status feedback while slurping

fields.description: This could be a neater solution - we could just point to our own version of the extension rather than checking/copying a new one -
fields.summary: HG: Use {{hg --config}} instead of writing into {{.hg/hgrc}}
HG: Initial implementation of basic slurp

fields.description: This will need to update a branch index to identify the first changeset of the branch. We can then in subsequent phases detect that it is a new branch and carry out the appropriate actions for LoC and Head tracking.
fields.summary: HG: Add ability to detect that a changeset is the first of a new branch

fields.description: Rather than slurping a branch at a time (a feature for svn etc, as the "main" branch appears first under an initial slurp), we really need to slurp in commit order, so that we get ancestor commits that have been merged into a branch before we hit the commit they have merged into.
fields.summary: HG: Support slurping all branches

fields.description:
Delete clone and reindex: (Clean re-index) adding to standard maintenance screens 

Required for cases where upstream history is edited and out clone gets unrepairably out-of-date.

Could be relegated to 2.3.1 or 3.0 and instead be done as a documentation task, manually deleting the clone on disk and we re-clone automatically, then re-scan.

* can be supported for git as well
fields.summary: HG: support clean re-index

fields.description: As more and more people start using Mercurial as their SCM of choice, we should consider adding support for this SCM or at least make it doable with a separate regular FishEye plugin.
fields.summary: Add support for Mercurial scm

fields.description:
Tags — we haven't got any tests with tags, and if there are any tags it will currently throw an UnsupportedOperationException. The implementation of tags should be basically the same as git's so it should be fairly straightforward.

Maybe be tricky to add support for tags on unmerged branches.

Hg tags are versioned, so we need to check if we're getting all tags when we call hg tags. Ideally, we would get all the tags even for unmerged branches, as they would probably be menaingful to people, but that may be next release.

Verify which version of the tags file we get.
fields.summary: HG: Add Tag support to Mercurial Slurping

fields.description:
There's a number of placeswhere it would be better to use the changeset index rather than the file revision history to be more performant.

Also look at whether navigating through the ancestry would be more space and time efficient that iterating over the entire file history.
fields.summary: HG: Get DvcsFileHistory.resolveRevisionFromString to use the changeset work where appropriate for performance

fields.description:
Commit numbers — we should store and display the local integer ids in addition to the global commit hash ids.
    * Show them in the browse revision history, diffs, annotations and activity stream in hg standard format of "rev#":"short hash"
    * Check for consistency elsewhere
fields.summary: HG: Store and display the hg rev id number

fields.description:
Check with Miochael if he's working on this as part of GWT redesign before getting into this.

Worst case this can be 2.3.1
fields.summary: HG: Add HG support to add repository admin screen

fields.description: git already does this - extend/reuse the same pattern to check that the version of hg we are using is compatible.
fields.summary: HG: Add check for version compatability

fields.description:
running hg command shas the overhead of starting up python and interpreting all the code. For short quick commands we do a lot of  (like felog and cat the contents of a file/rev), we could get a big win by having one hg process we could pipe commands at.

It should call gc.collect() each time round to make sure it frees memory.
fields.summary: HG: Create a "shell" for hg to avoid start up costs.

fields.description:
Currently, the committer is automatically mapped to a user if their committer and usernames are the same.

Given that the "convention" for git/hg is for commit names like "Matthew Watson <mwatson@atlassian.com>" we should look for an embedded email address in the committer name and map it to a user with the same email address if they exist.
fields.summary: HG/GIT: Map committers to users based on their embedded email address.

fields.description:
* to config.xsd
* to server settings admin screen (as per git executable)
fields.summary: HG: Add path to hg binary

fields.description:
Detect that commits we had scanned already have disappeared, indicating a history rewrite.

Will this happen?
Could be tricky, in that latest commit we know about may be ok, but preceeding commits are gone.
fields.summary: HG: Detect history rewrites and automatically trigger a rescan from the parent rev id

fields.description:
Set up basic framework for common testing scenarios.

Tests for
* tags
* branches
* Merging
* multiple heads
* binary files
* file names with:
** spaces
** URL/XML entities, \, %, ﻿! etc
** non-ascii characters
* copies/moves
* deletions
* merges with no content: merges where there is no clashes - all changes on each branch are to separate files
* case-insensitive filesystems, pulling a change with a case change in it.
* loc, per-author loc
* Merge commits with no changeset
* Permission changes, by themselves, combined with modification, copy, move
* file changes to directory/symlink & vice-versa
fields.summary: HG: Add basic Mercurial Slurp tests

fields.description:
Write a Mercurial Extension for gathering the information that FishEye requires that is otherwise difficult to retrieve from Mercurial

This includes:
* For Each commit:
** Files added/removed/renamed/copied/modified/perm changes
** For each file:
*** name
*** parent revision
*** Lines Of Code changes
fields.summary: HG: Mercurial extension for FishEye
HG: remove blocksize from config.xsd and hg slurper

fields.description:
h4. Test which versions felog works for:
* clone mercurial
* come up with a list of revs to run felog on (all of them?)
* Advance back tag by tag, running felog against that version of mercurial for all revs in the repo, until it breaks.

h4. Automated test:
* do the same as above for our supported revisions

Check with IT what version they can support.
fields.summary: HG: Determine which versions of hg we're supporting

fields.description: squash commits, clean up files so they can be reviewed as easily as possible
fields.summary: HG: Clean up code for committing to svn

fields.description: Currently there is some duplication - once more tests written, reduce this,
fields.summary: HG: refactor test framework for commonalities with git

fields.description:
stick a comment with a version on the first line, and if different, copy ours over.

Check when we do a pull.
fields.summary: HG: Detect if hgfelog.py needs upgrading upon startup and do so if neccessary.
HG: Double check hg case (in)sensitivity

fields.description:
Slurp a number of big repos from bitbucket etc 
Isolate any errors into new unit tests
fields.summary: HG: Test against real hg repos

fields.description: Validate we can stop a scan on demand from admin - should ask for all revs and parents, then ask for each commit and file content in a commit - scanning a commit should be our unit of work after which we check if we should stop. OR should we scan more frequently? Scanning a commit is still our logged item of work we would have to back up to.
fields.summary: HG: Allow Mercurial scanning to stop on demand ASAP
HG: Go through and identify TODOs in the code - resolve or create JIRAs

fields.description:
Currently does store all parents.
* git supports multiple parents: stored
* hg supports a primary parent and a merge (secondary) parent: stored
* svn supports merging, but not stored in db.

Currently there is no top-level support for ChangeSets - the denormalised DB schema means that we need to create a fake revision for merge changesets with no changes themselves. We need to spec how we would re-work this.

Downstream, this would enable support for:
* Display of multiple parent revisions in:
** Activity Stream
** ChangeSet view page: .../changelog/REPO?cs=XXXX
** Crucible Commit Lists
** Other locations?
* Graph View for ChangeSets
fields.summary: HG: scope work for storing multiple merge parents in changeset
HG: Test review creation and annotation view
